title: Discovery of Potent and Selective Activity-Based Probes (ABPs) for the Deubiquitinating Enzyme USP30
content:
RSC Chem. Biol., 2024, Accepted Manuscript
DOI: 10.1039/D4CB00029C, Paper
Open Access

Milon Mondal, Fangyuan Cao, Daniel Paul Conole, Holger Werner Auner, Edward William Tate
Ubiquitin-specific protease 30 (USP30) is a deubiquitinating enzyme (DUB) localized at the mitochondrial outer membrane and involved in PINK1/Parkin-mediated mitophagy, pexophagy, BAX/BAK-dependent apoptosis, and IKKβ-USP30-ACLY-regulated lipogenesis/tumorigenesis. A USP30 inhibitor, MTX652,...
